radiographic_examinations.findings: Pneumonia and a possible lucency in the left scapula.
Two lesions with increased activity involving the posterior spine of the left scapula and the medial cortex of the right femoral shaft.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: A lucent lesion within the left scapular spine with erosion of the cortical surface along the ventral aspect, intact dorsal cortex; numerous mildly enlarged mediastinal and bilateral hilar lymph nodes; ill-defined lung nodules; an indeterminate lesion in the left hepatic lobe; three other cystic lesions within the liver; thickening of the wall of the cecum.

Well-circumscribed lytic lesion in the left scapular spine with marked 18F-FDG uptake; hypodense nodules in the lower pole of the left lobe of the thyroid and the left lobe of the liver; scattered lymph nodes in the mediastinum.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: MRI of the left shoulder and right femur
radiographic_examinations.findings: A lesion in the left scapular spine measuring 23 mm by 14 mm; isointense on T1-weighted images, hyperintense on T2-weighted images, with heterogeneous enhancement and extension through the ventral cortex of the scapula.

radiographic_examinations.date: During first admission to this hospital
radiographic_examinations.findings: Low lung volumes and subtle fine reticulonodular opacities in both lungs.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple lung nodules (2 to 4 mm), cystic lucencies throughout both lungs, lymph nodes in both axillae and abdomen.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The imaging studies displayed small, irregular pulmonary nodules, some of which appeared cavitated and were associated with cysts.

radiographic_examinations.date: Follow-up after smoking cessation (3 months after discharge)
radiographic_examinations.findings: Almost complete resolution of the small nodules and cysts previously seen.
